txt.en: 'Okay, let's go! We'll teach these louts a thing or two about decent manners!'
'Are you ready to go? I'll see you out, my singing friend! Thanks again, and I hope this tale makes for a good song!'
'There's enough for all!'

'The man in charge of these brigands is called Holt Adderson, and he can't get away with this! Decent folk shouldn't have to worry about their things being stolen!\n\n'Keep track of what happens, [placeholder], and maybe you can come up with a song that will stir the hearts of good folk and will warn villains such as these brigands not to stoop to crime!'
Instance: A Song for the Company
Leland Underhill has been defeated
'You got it, boss!'
Leland Underhill has been defeated
Leland Underhill is looking to recover something that was stolen from him by brigands.\n\nLeland Underhill has asked you to help him.
'There he is! There's the man who stole my dinner!'
'I was just about to cook that roast, Holt!'
Leland Underhill is looking to recover something that was stolen from him by brigands.\n\nLeland Underhill has asked you to help him.
'That's what you think!'
Leland Underhill is inside the cave hideout of the brigands that stole his lunch.\n\nLeland Underhill is waiting to speak with you.
'Is there enough for me?'
'I'll have some too!'
'This hobbit is a capital fellow!'
'I could stand for a bite too!'
'It belongs to me now, and no puny fellow like you can get it back!'
'Teach them a lesson!'
'I stole it fair and square, and you can't have it back!'
Talk to Leland Underhill
Protect Leland Underhill
Protect Leland Underhill
Protect Leland Underhill
Talk to Leland Underhill
'I see you've already gone and started cooking it. Luckily, I have some utensils with me.'
'If you swear that you're done being a villain, I'll split the roast with you, Holt.'
'Just don't do it again, okay?'
'Well, now you know better!'
'So have you given up your villainous ways?'
Leland Underhill has found the hideout of the brigands that stole something valuable from him.
'Don't let me see you making a nuisance of yourself again!'
'Fine! You win! I can't believe I was beaten by a hobbit!'
'I hope you've learned your lesson!'
'You really should have known better! Honestly!'
'Someone needed to teach you a little courtesy!'
'Over here, my singing friend!'
'I give up! I give up!'
'There's no need to run. Good and honest folk walk!'
'Let me just carve up the roast, and then we'll be off! Let me know when you're ready to go!'
